text: The Hamilton Tigers were a professional ice hockey team, and a member of the National Hockey League (NHL). They were based in Hamilton, Ontario and played at Barton Street Arena. They played from 1920â€“1925. The Tigers were formed from the sale of the Quebec Bulldogs NHL franchise. After years of struggling, the team finished first in the league in the 1924-25 NHL season. However, after a players' strike at the end of the season the team broke up. ==Other websites== *Results on hockeydb.com Category:1920 establishments in Canada Category:1925 disestablishments Category:20th-century disestablishments in Canada Category:Defunct National Hockey League teams Category:Sport in Hamilton Category:1920s disestablishments in North America
title: Hamilton Tigers
